sub_title: Project Management | Public Diplomacy | | Outreach | Events management | EU-LAC Relations
summary:
Committed and proactive professional with progressive experience in project management, the development of public diplomacy strategies, and the facilitation of alliances with multiple stakeholders. Expert in the implementation of high-level events and outreach activities. Proven experience in supporting the financial and results monitoring of target-based projects and providing support to day-to-day administrative tasks. 

Highly motivated and goal-oriented professional with excellent communication skills. Able to work both independently or in a team. Experience working in multicultural environments at international organisations, the public and private sectors in Mexico, Belgium, the Czech Republic, and The Netherlands. 

General areas of interest (not limited to): public diplomacy, humanitarian response, international law, development cooperation, European affairs, EU-LAC relations, climate change and sustainable development.

certifications.name: Certificado Verificado de edX para el curso Data for Effective Policy Making

company.name: EQUINOCCIO, Compañía de Comercio Exterior S.L

profile_positions.company: EQUINOCCIO, Compañía de Comercio Exterior S.L
profile_positions.description:
I was part of the team in charge of implementing the second phase of the "EU Policy and Outreach Partnership project for Mexico and Central America"(EUPOP). The EUPOP is an EU-funded project implemented by Equinoccio in consortium with OEI, CEPS, and B&S Europe.

My mission aimed at supporting the development of long-lasting cooperation and engagement amongst the EU Delegations and 8 identified target audiences to strengthen the EU-Mexico/ EU-Costa Rica / EU-Panama bilateral relations. Some of the results achieved by the team were:
º Raising awareness and contributing to position the EU as a reference in areas such as climate change and biodiversity protection, gender equality, the youth, human rights, security, and multilateralism.  
º Successful implementation of more than 20 online and in-person high-level engagement and outreach activities between June 2021 and June 2022.
º Potential joint activities and additional topics were identified for further discussion and cooperation between the EU and its target audiences.
º More than 900 participants belonging to the target audiences attended the events and activities organized. 
º Relevant information and inputs were provided to feed the EU-MEX high-level Political Dialogues.
º New stakeholders were identified to join the cooperation networks established between the EU Delegations and its target audiences. 

My daily tasks included (amongst others):
º Design and implementation of high-level events and engagement strategies.
º Monitoring activities’ progress and results (activity, interim and pims reports).
º Drafting financial reports, supporting the administrative team to monitor the use of the project's budget and invoice follow-up.
º Identification and recruitment of experts.
º Design communication materials.
º Contact suppliers.
º Administrative tasks (updating databases, identifying stationery needs).
º Support temporary experts with various tasks and background research.
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant - EU Policy Outreach Partnership Mexico and Central America (Phase II)

profile_positions.company: EQUINOCCIO, Compañía de Comercio Exterior S.L
profile_positions.description:
I was temporarily hired to provide support during the inception phase of the Enhanced EU-GCC Political Dialogue, Cooperation and Outreach project, an EU-funded project implemented to contribute to a stronger relationship between the European Union and the GCC countries.

 My main tasks included:
º Contribute to the design and implementation of high-level events and cooperation strategies.
º Drafting of the inception report.
º Conduct background research
º Support the key experts with various tasks (drafting of Terms of Reference, identification of experts and potential partners, development of databases, etc.).
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant - EU-GCC Political Dialogue, Cooperation and Outreach

company.name: EQUINOCCIO, Compañía de Comercio Exterior S.L

profile_positions.company: EQUINOCCIO, Compañía de Comercio Exterior S.L
profile_positions.description:
I was part of the permanent team in charge of implementing the "EU Policy and Outreach Partnership project for Mexico, Central America and the Caribbean"(EUPOP). The EUPOP was an EU-funded project implemented by Equinoccio in consortium with AESA.

My mission aimed at supporting the development of long-lasting cooperation and engagement amongst the EU Delegations and 8 identified target audiences to strengthen the EU-Mexico/ EU-Costa Rica / EU-Panama bilateral relations. Some of the results achieved by the team were:
º Raising awareness and contributing to position the EU as a reference in areas such as green diplomacy, climate change and biodiversity protection, gender equality, human rights, scientific cooperation, security, and multilateralism. 
º Successful implementation of more than 60 online and in-person high-level engagement and outreach activities between October 2019 and November 2020.
º Potential joint activities and additional topics were identified for further discussion and cooperation between the EU and its target audiences.
º More than 5000 participants belonging to the target audiences attended the events and activities organized. 
º Relevant information and inputs were provided to feed the EU-MEX high-level Political Dialogues.
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant at EU Policy and Outreach Partnership - Mexico, Central America and the Caribbean

company.name: Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies

profile_positions.company: Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies
profile_positions.description:
My mission included providing direct support to the project managers and senior experts in charge of designing and implementing moot court competitions and international law summer programs. Some of the achievements of the team include:
º The successful implementation of the 2019 Telders International Law Moot Court Competition, the 2019 ICC Moot Court Competition, and the Children's Rights Moot Court Competition.
º The implementation of International Law summer schools, including the International Humanitarian Law program, the International Criminal Law program, and the Duke-Leiden Institute in Global and Transnational Law.

My tasks included:
º Supported the organization of high-level events (preparation of content, management of invitations, registration links and materials, meeting minutes, follow-up surveys, logistics, and on-site coordination).
ª Develop communication materials (invitations, booklets).
º Provide day-to-day administrative support (database updating, background research, stationery needs).
º Act as one of the focal points during the events.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Intern

profile_positions.description:
As part of my main achievements in this position are:
º Contribute to draft the "Joint Statement on the importance of democracy and democracy support in the EU Multi-annual Financial Framework (MFF 2021-2027)".
º Support the implementation of the visits of International IDEA regional officers and programmatic units to Brussels, and the Member States annual meeting.

My tasks included: 
º Enhancing visibility and dissemination of knowledge resources of International IDEA.
º Review, prepare and edited position papers and documents for its publication on the official social media networks.
º Provide support to the Director of the Office of International IDEA to the EU with background research and the development of position papers.
º Support the organization and implementation of top-level meetings 
º Monitor the EU Institution’s position on topics related to the work of the Office (democracy, electoral processes, rule of law, human rights, etc.).
º Provide support with various daily administrative tasks (documentation, updating databases,
identifying stationery needs, etc.)
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Intern

profile_positions.description:
Some of my main achievements as a planner-buyer were:
º Contribute to develop a process to improve the time for procurement response. 
º Support the design of a system to ensure the timely submission of quality permits requested by public health authorities. 

My tasks included:
º Procurement of raw materials and commodities (stock planning, import procedures and delivery follow-up) at the national level.
º Supporting the import of raw materials from abroad.
º Developing bilateral relations with key stakeholders (public, private, government agencies).
º Preparing monthly monitoring reports for decision-making.
º Collaborating with the financial and quality departments to ensure that internal processes were followed.
profile_positions.title: Planner Buyer

company.name: Secretaría de Relaciones Exteriores de México

profile_positions.company: Secretaría de Relaciones Exteriores de México
profile_positions.description:
My mission was to support the Embassy's public diplomacy strategy to attract foreign investment to Mexico. 

My tasks included:
º Implement and provide on-site support to the Embassy’s cultural and political high-level events.
º Monitor political developments across the Eastern-European region as well as media publications.
º Draft post-event reports and policy briefings.
º Provide administrative support to the Consular section.
profile_positions.title: Analyst assistant

profile_positions.description:
My mission as an advisor was to support Senior management to conduct risk assessment  for the development of new businesses and SMEs in Mexico, specifically in the northeast region of the country. 

My tasks included:
º Conduct background research.
º Assist the Senior Manager during briefing meetings. 
º Support the design of monitoring reports for decision-making.
º Feed and update the institute's website with relevant information.
profile_positions.title: Jr. Business Consultant

volunteer_experiences.description:

º Worked directly with Senior leadership to develop a storytelling program to facilitate the learning experience of young audiences and promote engagement.
